Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Michael D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A typical London budget hotel, everything was as expected (small room, old furniture, funny bathroom...). The location is very good, 10min walk to Victoria station, friendly and safe neighbourhood. But every experienced London visitor knows this type of hotel. Cleanliness o.k., tea and coffee making fac. exist. Rail track very near, but not to loud. Recommendation to advanced London tourists, all others should look for a more comfortable (but much more expensive) hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Álvaro G
Reviews.Content: The experience was terrible. The sound of the trains passing through the station at night was unbearable as the these were really close and the thin glass of the window barely block the noise, it was impossible for me to sleep. The room was also extremely hot and that was weird considering it was winter and that the heater was off. There were also cockroaches in my room. I travel a lot and I have visited a lot of different hotels and I can say without any doubt that Holly House Hotel has been the worst hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Sophie H
Reviews.Content: The staff were great but the place is like a dump.I paid about £400 for a week, so wasn't happy. During the week had three different bedrooms for various reasons.To add salt to injury 2 days before I was due to checkout, the heating packed in and the room had old windows which could not keep the cold out. I was told they had no other heater that could be used.Would advise against staying here.I chose due to location.Would never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and cheap”
Reviews.Author: GuernseyJes
Reviews.Content: When i arrived at the guest house i was taken to my room that was in a building 2doors down the road (the annex), it was quite nice but very warm i had to turn the rad right down (but i guess hot is better then cold) it was in a very good place quite close to victoria station :-) I had a very good nights sleep, I didnt have breakfast because i had to leave early to get my flight so i dont know what that was like but all in all it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Simply an economical option”
Reviews.Author: Ward W
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, furnishings worn, and management was haphazard. The location is excellent and we slept well. Nothing fancy but you do get what you pay for. I would stay here again if the budget is tight. We could have found something nicer but paid 50% more. we were satisfied but not delighted.

Reviews.Title: “fine for a cheap place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Claire J
Reviews.Content: read reviews on here that simply arent true, you get what you pay as and for the price i couldnt complain, the room was clean and the beds had fresh sheets and bedding on, we had a towel each with bar of soap, tea/coffee and fridge in room as well as lcd tv which worked fine. this hotel is close to all links and in a great location. it is ideal for a place to lay your head after a day exploring. if you want luxury then pay luxury prices but on a budget this hotel is fine. would use this place again, i couldnt really complain for the price we paid, bathroom is small and could use some updating but like i said you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE.....the place has cochroaches!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah R
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for unfortunatley two nights, it was appaulling! On arrival we checked in and was told we had to stay another house called The Annexe two doors down. When we arrived we were greeted by building material in the hall way leaving us with very little space to even work through to get up the three flights of stairs past the smelly toliet and shower cupboard! Our room was adquate even had a fridge. The walls were disgusting and the toliet room stunk! On the first night there i had the WORST nights sleep as the room backed onto Victoria trainstation so every hour a train went past and woke me....we could not shut our window as the place had its central heating turned on all the time at 30oC- we were baking! Breakfast again was an epic we were told we had to get ourselves to another house down the street for it! Second day got better, when we discovered and watched a cochroache run across the floor in our room! When we arrived back from going out, opened the toliet door in our room we discovered a further 3 running around. Avoid this hotel at all costs!!!!!!! You have been warned!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: pinklady1410
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night earlier this month. My friend booked the room as she has stayed here on a few other occasions. I unfortunately read everyoneâ€™s reviews on here before I went so I wasnâ€™t holding out any hope of it being anything more than a hell hole. Firstly, without the risk of sounding like a snob, Iâ€™ve never stayed in a hotel like it, but it wasnâ€™t that bad. The hotel owns 5 other hotels on the same street, you check in at Holly House Hotel. We were staying in Cedar Hotel and in the only basement room (room 71) in the hotel. When we got into the room it was being cleaned, so we left our bags and went exploring round London. By the time we got back, the room had been cleaned. It was boiling hot and looked to be clean and tidy. We had 2 (clean) towels each and a bar of soap. The tea and coffee facilities were good; the mugs, water glasses and spoon were all individually packed which was a good sign. The beds were comfy and despite people on here saying that they were dirty, they werenâ€™t. We booked a twin room and got a triple room, which was 1 single and 1 double bed. There was a small flat screen TV which was good and a decent sized mirror too, ample plug sockets around the room too. There is also a fridge in the room which came in handy for pre-theatre drinks. The only downside to the room was the bathroom, it was tiny and smelt grim. It didnâ€™t seem the cleanest either. But, the shower was good with a constant supply of hot water. They serve breakfast from 7am â€“ 9am but we didnâ€™t try it. Being in the basement room, anyone who walked up and down the corridor above us woke me up. And in the morning, when some inconsiderate guests were going for breakfast, who werenâ€™t very quiet at all, I got woke up by them (the restaurant is in the basement too) The room also backed onto the train line behind the hotel, which was very busy but the noise of the trains wasnâ€™t too bad, unless youâ€™re a light sleeper. I wouldnâ€™t book this hotel for a nice break to the City with my partner but I probably would stay here again with a friend, as location wise it was perfect for us (we were going to the Victoria Theatre) Iâ€™m not sure Iâ€™d recommend it to people but I wouldnâ€™t say to strictly avoid it, especially if you are on a tight budget. We paid Â£60 a night B&B, which in London is a bargain. The main thing with this hotel is â€“ you really do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap n cheerful”
Reviews.Author: jonathancloud
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Holly House B&B in October 2011 for two nights with my 14 year old daughter. Twin en suite room on the top floor. We chose it on the low price and being near to Victoria bus station (megabus cheap travel) and the theatre we had tickets for. It was clean, the staff were friendly, and suitable for a short stay on a tight budget. The room was small but clean, the en suite was tiny but functional, it had a small fridge, kettle and tea and coffee, and a small TV. Even with the window open it wasn't too noisy for central London, the trains aren't noticable. Breakfast is simple cereal and toast, tea, coffee, orange juice. We were welcome to leave our bags in the dining room at our own risk for a few hours after check out. Basic, but at Â£108 for 2 nights B&B it was pleasant enough. Don't expect anything more than a cheap base to save money better spent on other delights London has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Not as website shows”
Reviews.Author: Gemsy D
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as the location was excellent to where we needed to be and the pictures on the website made the accomodation look ok. On arrival the reception was fine nothing special but then the room was just completely NOT what I expected. The decor is dingy and univiting generally but the rooms felt like I had booked time in a nuns convent. The room was cramped with two small single beds somehow shoved in, with just about room to move on foot from one side to the other or to bathroom. The bedding was clean but so basic and bland. Being at the top it was so warm and we could only open the top part of the window which made no difference. BUT then the ensuite - now I am not a big person but I struggled to fit myself in there to use the toilet which was badly put in as you could not even keep the seat lid up, you had to balance it on your back and the shower was just NOT going to be attempted to be used as it was so univiting and small to say the least. Then to top it off I was expecting a bit of choice at breakfast with the continental declaration and firstly there was no room for 3 of us in this hotel so we got sent down the road to another one that we barely got into. The choice then was poor, one piece of toast each and a couple of cereals to choose from. It was all too small and dingy for my liking, I wished I had booked the holiday inn. On the plus side I found the beds clean and comfortable and like I said the location was ideal. Hopefully the hotel owners will consider the first impression of their hotel - and bit of colour or a looked after feel would be an improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Dingy and HORRIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: Nat P
Reviews.Content: This "hotel" is filthy, poorly presented and the service is dire. I have stayed in youth hostels with better facilities. We booked a twin ensuite room and received a double with a filthy communal bathroom on the floor below - not exactly pleasant, especially as the lock didn't work so we were terrified to use it! The staff were rude and lazy. We went into reception to ask to change rooms (we hadn't been told upon check-in that our room wasn't what we had requested) and found the man lying on the floor behind the desk, trying to sleep. At five thirty in the evening! . We didn't pay a lot for our stay as we booked through travelstay.com, but I still feel we were ripped off. We decided not to stay in the hotel, but were then told that we would have to pay anyway, so we had no choice. We didn't sleep as my friend and I had to share a bed, which we weren't comfortable with and we could hear rustling that sounded like mice and a weird high pitched squeak (like a broken smoke detector) every two minutes throughout the night. Breakfast was soggy cheap cereal and cold toast with stewed tea or coffee granules and luke warm water. I asked for some orange juice (I noticed other people had some) but was told that they had run out. It is only two minutes from Victoria station and 10 from Buckingham Palace but I would NEVER stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “I didn't think there were still hotels like this”
Reviews.Author: Scribble_dog
Reviews.Content: OK, positives first. Handy location. The shower had plentiful hot water. You are given a map which entitles you to tourist discounts, and a business guide to the area. The sheets were clean and the staff, while not bursting with enthusiasm, were pleasant enough. But...the place looks as if it's been furnished from a council skip. It's shabby, tatty, grubby, grim, dreadful by any standard of taste. Although the sheets were clean, the headboard wasn't. I didn't dare look at the mattress. There was a folding chair/bed covered in nameless stains. Ugh. My room, booked as single, had a double bed, which was a bonus, and also bunk beds, so it could have been let to a family of four. There was something which was supposed to be a wardrobe, very narrow and unable to take anything longer than a jacket. Inside were two hangers. In a room for four? Come on! There was a TV, which I didn't bother with. No hairdryer, no facility to make hot drinks in rooms. The 'view' from my window was a cell-like concrete yard with a grime-caked toddler's plastic swing in it, nothing else, not even a pot plant. Despite being near to Victoria, the hotel would have been quite quiet, if not for a loud electronic bleep that went off four times every six seconds or so, and continued all night. I don't know what it was but I now have some idea what it feels like to undergo the Chinese water torture. For breakfast I was offered cornflakes, cocoa pops or all- bran. I don't like any of these, but chose cornflakes as the least sickly and received a fair-sized portion. Toast was white, no brown bread on offer, no margarine. Just white bread, butter, jam. The coffee came as instant coffee powder with a pot of hot water, a new low in B&B catering as far as I'm concerned. NB the Ivy House hotel next door is the same establishment! I was given a feedback sheet to fill in so perhaps they are trying to improve, but if they can't see for themselves what the place needs then I don't hold out much hope for them.

Reviews.Title: “Ever considered a minus rating? Here is the reference.”
Reviews.Author: 810oulala
Reviews.Content: Smiling and welcoming staff. Otherwise crap, cramp, moisty, noisy, dirty, smelly: a XXI century disgusting version of Charles Dickens account in dodgy London. It is not a nightmare for when you wake-up (should you have been be able to fall asleep) you are actually there: it is a punishment!

Reviews.Title: “If I could give this a minus,,,,,,,I would !!!”
Reviews.Author: ghpumpkin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just spent 2 nights in the worst hotel ever !! I chose this hotel because we were going on a 3 day Theatre break in London, travelling by coach and wanted to be close to the coach station. This is THE ONLY positive thing about this hotel. On arrival we were sent to another hotel, obviously part of the same group of hotels, 5 doors away where we had been put in the first room on the ground floor, conveniently located right next to the front door!! which was constantly being opened throughout the night, it was a heavy door on a spring so everyone walked in and let the door slam shut after them, this shook our room and woke us up several times. The windows were old fashioned single pane sash windows, in fact my husband thought the window was wide open as it was so noisy and draughty!! The ensuite was ridiculous, the door opened only part way as the toilet stopped it and you had to sit on the loo at a 45% angle, the toilet seat was loose, the cold water tap had no pressure, there was no plunger on the sink plug so it could not be filled, the light fitting had been placed in such a way that the door caught on it when you opened it, the wood weather board on the inside of the door was hanging off with 2 screws sticking out, the toilet itself was surprisingly, clean !! There was a shelf above the radiator which was sloping so badly that you couldn't put anything on it. The "wardrobe" was a home built affair that was about 12 inches wide,,,,useless.There was a fridge,,,,,noisy all night long. The whole room needed a coat of paint, wallpaper was hanging off the wall, and there were greasy marks on the wall above the bed where people had been leaning,,,,,,,yuk !!! all these things could have so easily been put right for a few pounds. The bedding was clean tho. The advertised "continental breakfast" consisted of choice of 3 cereals,,,,,, corn flakes, cocoa pops, all bran, plus orange juice, tea or coffee and toast. As far as I'm concerned continental breakfasts always contain croissants at least ! I definately would not recommend this hotel. We definately will not be going back, the pictures on the website bear NO RESEMBLANCE to what we got !! My advice ? pay a bit more and go somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “NO WIFI, otherwise bearable”
Reviews.Author: Jessica K
Reviews.Content: Holly House is, overall, an okay deal for what you pay. Starting with the cons: 1) Do NOT count on the Wifi they claim to have. In the 3 days we were there, it was working for half a day. (They were also completely unapologetic when it was down, which was almost constantly.) More importantly, the Wifi does NOT work at all in any of the houses, other than the main "Holly House." As other reviewers have pointed out, there are a few houses all in a row next to the Holly House itself, and its more likely than not that youâ€™ll actually be staying in one of these houses, rather than "Holly House" proper. So I definitely feel itâ€™s pretty misleading on the hotelâ€™s part to claim they have Wifi because it rarely works, and actually only functions in just one of the many houses that they put their guests up in. We were counting on the Wifi to make plans/be in touch with friends and not having it was beyond inconvenient. (Luckily the Starbucks around the corner has free Wifi, but itâ€™s still not super-convenient when you thought youâ€™d be emailing from bed.) 2) Thereâ€™s a generally dinginess to the hotel, just in general. Nothing atrocious, but not super well-maintained. 3) The rooms are truly minuscule. We had big bags, as we were traveling for almost 2 weeks, and we could barely open them inside the room. I know, youâ€™re barely in the room anyway when youâ€™re traveling, but by day 3 I was lusting after the Days Inn around the corner... 4) No fans/temperature moderation of any kind. I bet this is probably fine usually, but it did get quite warm when we were there (it was August) so the room definitely had some stuffiness to it. But you can open the windows, that helped a bit. But there are also pros! 1) LOCATION! The posh Victoria neighborhood is super safe, beautiful, and about as centrally located as you can get. Minutes from the tube/buses/coaches/rail lines, etc. 2) They really mean it when they say they have 24-hour check in. We arrived at some God-awful hour, like 2 AM, and the check in desk was manned, as promised, and our room was ready for us. 3) Clean sheets and everything, every day. 4) Thereâ€™s a fridge! Great for leftovers. So all in all, as an already-broke American dealing with a horrific exchange rate, I found this hotel to be, ya know, okay. If it werenâ€™t for the whole Wifi fiasco I think the experience would have been exponentially better. PS They have an official form from whatever association gives hotels star-ratings, saying they have been awarded one star, framed like it's a work of art. I took a picture.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Stephhelen
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of nights at this hotel, we weren't expecting anything special after reading the reviews but we'd left it too late to search and book anything else so thought we'd take a chance. The decor in reception wasn't inspired but we certainly didn't have to pay with cash up-front, we paid normally by card. We were then taken to the 'Annex' two doors down and told where to go for breakfast in the morning. Our triple room was on the ground floor, front facing, with a double bed and a single. The shower was more of a mini wet room which included the toilet and small sink, excellent pressure and ample hot water for the three of us though. The beds had crisp white sheets, towels were white, fluffy and changed each day. There was very limited storage space but a good sized fridge and modern flat screen TV with remote. The room was well lit, with ceiling light and two wall lights. After a very quiet night, the road is a quiet private residential one, we went next door for breakfast, there are two breakfast rooms and we helped ourselves to cereal, four differrent ones on offer, we were served tea, coffee and juice and had ample, well cooked toast, plenty of butter and jams. It's not a very inspired 'continental' breakfast but perfectly adequate, the staff were helpful and brought us endless refills on request. We saw no evidence of insects, the decor was 'well used' but we were quite comfortable there, it's unusual in London to find somewhere as convenient, in such a good location and so quiet for such a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: magictoasty
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I needed a room last minute. Was happy to find something available but it's no wonder why, smarter wiser people than myself obviously knew to avoid this place. At reception I was greeted by a man who seemed to think a grunt would suffice as a hello. I'd booked a single room but when I arrived I was told it wasn't ready yet, despite it being 4 o'clock and check out is at 10 am. They told me to come back later, which I couldn't because I had plans, and I wanted somewhere safe to leave my belongings so I demanded another room. They agreed to this and gave me a double ensuite for a discounted price which I was happy about. I'd been in my new room all of 10 minutes when a member of staff starts banging on the door telling me to get out because someone else needs this room. I had to get all my stuff together and leave, and they insisted my original room still wasn't ready because they were 'redecorating'. I agreed to leave my bags and when I returned that evening my new 'redecorated' room was finally ready... what a joke. It smelled like something had died in there and the walls were mouldy and the carpet heavily stained. Cockroaches thrown in as an added bonus. The next morning I was awoken by staff at 8 o clock telling me to get out of my room because they had more 'redecorating' to do, and not to come back until 10 o clock that evening. What a joke, I got back and absolutely nothing had changed. Horrible, horrible attitudes and service. The bathrooms were clean, however, but this doesn't count for much thanks to the awful treatment you receive from the staff. Avoid this place at all costs, not worth a penny of the money I paid for my room!

Reviews.Title: “i like only shower room no 3”
Reviews.Author: samihaj7
Reviews.Content: its very good shower and toilets best of choice avrege brek fast not power clen room and very bad noice of train but only good for quek travling

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Moncan
Reviews.Content: We booked a doublÃ©room but we got to singles one in the basement and one on the topfloor in the other house.Wery small rooms.Rude staff. Drains from the toilet right utside the window so it smell when the window were open. Poor breakfast. They say on one of there internetsites.... "You will find yourself as comfortable as your home because of our friendly and personalized service. Every morning, a Full Continental Breakfast is served in our spacious dining room......and i say HAHAHAHAHA

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, not a great hotel though”
Reviews.Author: littlejingles
Reviews.Content: We made this trip on a tight budget and admit didn't pay very much at all. If returning to London I would pay a little bit more next time and go elsewhere as this place isn't very nice at all. We booked four nights and it was very easy to find from Victoria bus station. We stayed at the annexe which is just down the road a bit. It's a pretty grim place and didn't smell very fresh at all. It was pretty grubby and the furniture etc was old / worn. We literally used it as a base as it is in a very central location with all the main sights in walking distance. Had a swift drink before returning to the hotel each night and was back out again first thing in the morning. The continental breakfast is toast, smart price cornflakes and a cup of coffee is on offer (but we never got it). Didn't bother after the first day. Can't complain too much as it was so cheap. But if they gave it a lick of paint, a good scrub and updated the furnishings I would return. Not that it probably matters to them with the price so low there are probably loads of people willing to take the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Small room with decent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sibant
Reviews.Content: Booked a suite for 4. Turns out the suite is on the top floor. Our luggages are quite heavy, so there are some heavy lifting since there is no lift. Room is small but clean, with a queen bed and two double beds. The private bathroom is extremely tiny, and when you shower the water with be all over the bathroom and onto the toilet seat. They do have two other bathrooms to share with other tenants. Breakfast is very decent at the basement of the complex, with very decent decor, generous portion of orange juice, toast and tea/coffee. The staff are friendly and helpful. Location for the hotel is good. With luggages, it is about 10 minutes' walk from Victoria station. We walked to Buckingham Palace in 10-15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't honor reservation as made, lied about it, wouldn't fix broken TV”
Reviews.Author: CruiserArt
Reviews.Content: I made an Internet reservation for a room with twin beds which was confirmed. When we arriived we were given a room with one single bed and the explanation there was a plumbing problem with the room I reserved. I found out the next day they had simply rented our room to someone else and lied about it. The second day we were switched to a room with twin beds, but the TV didn't work. A man was sent to fix it, but said he needed to do something to complete the repair and that he would be back in 15 minutes. He never came back. No TV. Checked out the next morning. It is clear the staff of this hotel simply doesn't care and lies freely. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “19th Century Poet John Ruskin said...”
Reviews.Author: DavetheSheep
Reviews.Content: "It's unwise to pay too much, but it's worse to pay too little. When you pay too much, you lose a little money â€” that is all. When you pay too little, you sometimes lose everything, because the thing you bought was incapable of doing the thing it was bought to do. The common law of business balance prohibits paying a little and getting a lot â€” it can't be done. If you deal with the lowest bidder, it is well to add something for the risk you run, and if you do that you will have enough to pay for something better. " Unfortunately I booked this hotel BEFORE checking on TripAdvisor and so incurred a no show fee, but thanks to you guys I avoided being stuck in London late at night with no hotel. I paid a bit more and stayed at the very good Avon Hotel in Paddington instead, which was teriffic, with clean rooms and breakfast cooked to order.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling”
Reviews.Author: jensrohrbeck
Reviews.Content: I am appalled if I have to stay in a dingy place, with dilapidated, old pieces of furniture. I perceive it as an insult to me and shameful for you to put anybody up in a room like that. The room needs serious renovating. And until it is, you should not be allowed to rent it out. You should be ashamed of yourselves. They actually put me up in a different Hotel, called Cedar House, which was not the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good & efficient”
Reviews.Author: DavChandra
Reviews.Content: For what I paid, this hotel is good, relative to other hotels, and in line with my expectations. Clean bed, room, bathroom, and breakfast room. Efficient front desk staff. I paid in cash only at check-out time, provided full personal details at check-in. No complaints really. WYSIWYP - What you see is what you pay.

Reviews.Title: “grubby and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: cyberneal
Reviews.Content: do not stay here!overpriced,noisy,unhelpfull,dirty and in need of total repaint,this is not a hotel!not even near,beds terrible,dirty and basic,very basic,overpriced and bad impression iff you want to stay in london,you could not swing a cat in here.we arrived and were welcomed with a grunt,no help with baggage,poor first impression and did not get much better,only plus point was girl serving breakfast managed half a smile,breakfast room has only 4 tables and gets full quickly,this place has poor cleanlinessand should be renamed ,one step up from park bench!one of the worst place i have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: bikerbop
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely HORRIBLE. The location is great but even that doesn't make it a worthwhile stay. The fridge was so high up I couldn't reach it. The electric kettle hadn't been cleaned from the last user. The bathroom was smaller than a phone booth and smelled like a camp outhouse. The floor was so dirty my feet turned black. I booked single room and got a room with bunk beds. The noise from the train station was so loud it was impossible to sleep. You have to pay cash upon check in which is terribly inconvenient. I checked in around 7pm and the front desk clerk was beyond rude. He wasn't helpful at all. The stair wells are very narrow so if you have luggage larger than what fits in an overhead compartment on a plane, check it at Victoria Station for your stay. Unfortunately my family is staying there this week and I didn't have a way to contact them to rebook. What the pictures look like and what the guest gets is entirely different. I would have loved my money back on this one. It's horrid. Don't stay there. You can have a more comfortable stay at a hostel... or a park bench.

Reviews.Title: “1* B&B only good thing is location don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: jejen8080
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were made to pay cash up front for entire stay, even the reception was awful, looks like a minicab office, staff not very friendly. Did not get receipt and man looked suprised when i asked for one despite shelling out over 100 pounds for a 2 night stay. We were facing the front of the property which was purely luck as back faces onto railway line. Bed was comfortable and sheets clean didn't hear noise from trains as was expecting as was facing the front. Good nights sleep overall. Room was tiny, no hanging space, small cupboard that would fit about 3 hangers in it and wouldn't fit dresses etc only tops is not ample hanging space for a B&B. En suite was disgusting, we had bugs crawling around in there and the shower was vile, didn't use shower in end and ended up using communal loo as was much cleaner (although still not pleasant) Avoid booking an en suite and save yourself a bit of money. I was very worried about the reviews on here but I think we got lucky but still would not stay here again, spend a little more and stay somewhere clean. This is a hostel not a B&B and certainly not 2* as described on booking website, it displayed it's 1* certificate on the wall in the mini cab office sorry reception. Location was amazing less than 5 min walk from victoria station this is the only plus point.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory for one night only”
Reviews.Author: Mattinbrum
Reviews.Content: Satisfactory only for a brief stop over, offers basic but clean facilities. We didn't have chance to try breakfast, but this was advertised as continental only. Our room overlooked the busy railway lines, so you may wish to request a room at the other side of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but smelly & tiny bathroom, horrible view & loud noise from train station means no sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Holidayz25
Reviews.Content: The room was small and basic which was fine. I booked the double room with ensuite which was falsely advertised as no one in their right mind would ever call it an ensuite as it was just so small that it should be illegal to call it an ensuite (see photo). The bathroom needed a really good clean as it smelled bad & was mouldy. The bathroom had a toilet with the hand basin above the toilet so that when you wash you hands you can't help but splash water onto the toilet. Then there was the "shower" which was really just a drain & a nozzle on the wall, there was no shower door/curtain so we couldn't have a shower that night as we knew from the setup that we would get water everywhere so had to wait until the next morning before we checked out to have a shower. As expected, the bathroom was a watery mess after having a shower with water all over the toilet & floor. The view from our room was of an old discarded toilet & an old discarded door which was very disappointing (see photo). The location was good but it was too close to Victoria Train Station as it was too loud to get any sleep. It was very disappointing & i wish i had booked somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Very poor!!”
Reviews.Author: MissKitty81
Reviews.Content: On arriving I was made to pay up front immediately. The staff was impolite and unprofessional with very poor knowledge of English.They took me to my so-called first room, a tiny biscuit box with no bathroom. Water dropped out from the fridge on to the bed (it was completely wet) which I didn't see at first. When I told the guy the fridge was leeking he just smiled at me and said "it's the fridge". I complained and said I booked a room with bathroom but he said there is only shared toilets for single rooms and they were booked out and was told I couldn't expect a room with a bathroom for 40 Â£ per night - oh yes you can!!! But obviously the staff has never learnt how to run a business properly. I was also offered to check out and when I asked them if they knew an alternative because I had nowhere else to go they replied it wasn't their problem where I could find another place. I was furious and I eventually got moved into another building where the room was even smaller. It was moldy, dusty and smelly. No wardrobe or shelves to put my clothes, just 2 broken hangers so I had to leave everything on the floor. Of course I left my bags closed - I was scared some insects would creep into it!! I didn't touch anything in the room, not even the kettle. Water had been in there - I don't really want to know for how long!! The remote control for the TV was so dirty and sticky that I refused to touch it and just watched BBC1 that came up when the TV switched on manually. The door handles where sticky as well, the list is endless, I could write a book. By trying to find the breakfast room the guy at the reception said "I will show you, but this is the last time now" - very rude, would have loved to smack him. The breakfast was basic - not bad - it states continental but it's not. Just simple toast and cereals. By asking for a knife because it wasn't set on I was given a bread knife!! This hotel is a freakshow, I would not recommend anyone to stay in here. I know London is expensive - but for your health's sake - spent a little extra money for a decent place!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, central ,cheap yet rundown and dated B and B”
Reviews.Author: odysseus53
Reviews.Content: This property includes several other adjacent buildings and annexes yet is all part of the same enterprise.Make no mistake this is not a hotel but a low end budget bed and breakfast operation and due to its central position (2 mins from airbus and victoria station) would seem the ideal budget location for those spending their time out in London and retyuning merely to rest!! It has been given a severe hammering in reviews and probably rightly so if you try to compare it with even mediocre hotel properties. The reception area is reminiscent of a 60's taxi cab office about 3metres by 2 metres and immediately you know what you are getting yourself into . Take rooms at the back or in the basement at your peril as they are dim, noisy and , with overpowering smell of musty air and mould from bathroom (1.5 m x 0.8m)similar to a bugdet spacesaver cabin on a ferry (but less hygeienic).TIP,1..if you get these rooms ask for change and dont pay till you have a room you are satisfied with(There are some good ones at the front!)2.Open the window and leave it so and pull on the fan when leaving to kep room dry!.These rooms although pokey and virtually no hanging space are then habitable and good value for sleeping and who in their right mind would stay in the lower floor rooms longer than need be.3.Have a shower early or it will be a cold one as water runs out, although shower is hot and good flow. The housekeeping and cleaning in the room were excellent with lovely crisp sheets and a marvelouslly comfortable bed also sheets changed 3 out of 4 days although decdor,design , amenites and space are atrocious.Fridge tiny, tv minute with permanent snowstorm, drawers hanging in there just and no wardrobe merely a louvred compartment jammed in an alcove.Kettle fine yet crazy shelves where everything rolls or slips onto floor.Bring own tea and coffee as that provided is vile.Sleep quality was excellent at the front of property till 6am when a chorus of suitcase trolley wheels fills the street outside. Breakfast is cereal, toast and jams and is filling if but a little basic.Get out quick then and enjoy thye city on your doorstep with the money saved..value excellent, convenience superb.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it !!! Worst hotel in world ??? .... PROBABLY!!!”
Reviews.Author: wtb1977
Reviews.Content: Walking up the street in a very nice area a few minutes walk from Victoria Station a typical quaint English street I thought we were in for a great stay. We entered the hotel to be greeted by a Reception area that resembles a cross between a taxi office in a rough neighbourhood in the 70's and a prison visiting area from the movies with the old school wired security glass. I should have at this point turned round and walked out but for some stupid reason we proceeded to check in and had to pay for the accomodation up front.. we were then given our key and given directions to the cupboard sorry I mean room. The stairs to the room are so narrow you need to carry case infront or behind as you cant walk up with by your side. Upon entering the room things start to get even worse the room is an awful room with a 3/4 size bed with a stained quilt (but I must say the white sheets looked very clean) the room looked so dirty and dated. The heat in the room was unbearable. The bathroom is basicly a shower over the loo and a tiny sink that has mould stained into the grout. We went to reception to ask if other rooms available but was advised non available. We did not even attempt the inclusive breakfast and then checked out after the most uncomfortable night of my life. I have travelled around the world and stayed in a lot of hotels and this is by far the worst I have ever stayed in. The location is excellent but does not made up for this horible, dirty smelly hotel. TV did not work could get no reception, although the room did have a 50 year old fridge.

Reviews.Title: “NO NO NO”
Reviews.Author: mchic2008
Reviews.Content: I arrived from Victoria Station and it was a short 5 minute walk to the Hotel. The Hotel makes you pay on arrival to ensure they have your money before you see the room. We booked an ensuite room which was barely big enough for us both to be in at the same time (and we're not fatties). One person had to climb on the bed for the other to get in, no room at all after you park your cases. The room itself looked in disrepair, the TV was about 20 years old and tiny with a very bad signal. Woodchip wallpaper was peeling off the walls, the edges of the carpet and windows were filthy. I didn't dare look behind the bed.. There was a fan in the room which was broken, but had been stapled back together (like that's safe)! Other guests had written on the wall - which the Hotel had simply scribbled over - how professional. The 'bathroom' was a tiny cupboard, you have to lean against the sink to use the loo. The shower was surrounded by green, dirty tiles. Nowhere to put towels, sticky door handles, the list is endless. The staff are not friendly, in fact they are quite intimidating as they stare and sneer at you as you enter and leave the property. Don't make the mistake I did. There are much better places to stay around here, if it's cheap, it's cheap for a good reason!! It's a shambles!

Reviews.Title: “Appalling, atrocious and revoltingâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: BarberyTraveller
Reviews.Content: Upon paying the ridiculous amount of Â£65.00 a night (room with ensuite) I was escorted by a rather intimidating Asian man to an adjacent hotelâ€” the Alexander Hotel. Upon I arrival, I was told my room was in the third floor; I had to drag my luggage up three floors through the narrowest and steepest of stairs. The room was tiny. Thatâ€™s not the worst though, I can do small. The room was furnished with primitive prison furniture. Pathetic. The walls had not been painted in decades the room was musky and the air was thick. To insult to injury, the end of the rail station was 10 meters from my room so you could hear the screeching sound of the trains breaking constantly. Ridiculous. I do not recommend this pathetic excuse of a hotel to anyone. Third world country. It was so bad I didnâ€™t even bother going to the basement for â€œbreakfastâ€�. Do not stay in this hotel. Do so at your guaranteed absolute dissappointment...

Reviews.Title: “Nice cost-value hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: 7colinas
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, superb location concerning price. 5 min walk to Victoria Station, 15 min walk to Buckingham Palace! Stayed in room 45 at Anexxe Hotel (34, Hugh Street) couple doors down Holly House, same owner. Simple breakfast with toast, coffee, milk, all-bran cornflakes, coco pops, butter and some jams gave us the start for the day. It was served in Cedar Guest House (30, Hugh Street), i think all same owner. We had a very tiny ensuite bathroom, but for a backpacker couple had everything we need. Room with tv, refrigerator, kettle, fan, small wardrobe and bed, no table and no chair. View to Hugh Street. Free internet but only one computer at Holly House. Check-in and out easy. All Hindustan personnel with poor knowledge about London area regarding bus and metro, try at Victoria Station because there you have it all you need. Wake up call can consist in knocking at your door if you need it. Check out at 10am and asked if we can leave bags there, they said yes. DidnÂ´t feel confident in doing that cause we leave it down stairs near a kitchen with no eyes on it, nevertheless when we took them back there were no signs of other hands. At reception in Holly House you can see trough window of reception a central with lots of cctv cameras where they keep always a guy on it, that gave me some feeling of security regarding my room. No problems regarding the area, just be sure to choose the main streets near Victoria, donÂ´t pick the empty and dark streets. Very good pub (St Georges Tavern) at the end of Hugh Street towards Victoria. At Victoria there is some 24hrs shops (eat & drink) which come in handy as we arrived past midnight.

Reviews.Title: “There is too many of these crappy B&B's in London”
Reviews.Author: saladoor
Reviews.Content: After maneuvering around the broken stained bed in the corridor we were shown to our sparse room, which was not en-suite, was roasting and had very poor substandard furniture in it. When I say furniture, I mean two rickety beds, at different levels, with the usual urine colored duvets. I have to say the white undersheets were very clean, very! Shame about the dust everywhere! Anyhow, I opened a window and went to look for a toilet, there was two toilets and one shower for three floors, the toilet was so small, I could not turn round in it. The shower was a wet room built in to an alcove, which is fine in your room, but when you are wet and needing to dry properly, other guests don't take kindly to you striding through the place half naked! The breakfast, described as continental was far from, toast and cereal, but was adequate actually and it was nice to have a selection of two juices on the table. Wouldn't stay here again, and for what we paid and we have stayed many, many, many times in London over the last five years, I know I can get better value elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “We still laugh about this room!”
Reviews.Author: bbprice
Reviews.Content: We wanted to find something reasonable in London. First mistake. Not friendly staff. Hauling a suitcase up 4 flights of stairs infront of me (because I could not carry it next to me, the stairs were so narrow) and getting to the door and my husband telling me to go in. I told him I was in! The room had maybe 8 square feet of floor, the rest was the tiny uncomfortable double bed, closet cabinet, and bath closet. We both fell onto the bed laughing in disbelief. It was hot, so the one huge window at the head of the bed we opened. It was on the busy street, and loud. Early morning both mornings a woman went out, and tried to start her sick Mercedes. It would turn over and tease us like it would start, but not. Over, and over, and over again. She would move it to another space once going, but it would konk out many times between spots. And then the traffic would let loose with the horns. It was the show each morning. This was after not sleeping because the walls were like paper, and the man next to us snored something wicked. Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for people on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: FALEVILLE
Reviews.Content: A very basic hotel. London is such an expensive place to stay so at 34 pounds a night for 2people thats an absolute bargin. Its not a posh hotel, but if you need a place to sleep and running hot water then this is the place for you. The breakfast was basic..toast and cereal with juice tea or coffee. The rooms were very small but what do you expect from london central BUT the best thing was that they are very close to Victoria station literally 5mins stroll. The internet was also free!!! I'lld definitely stay here again....but if I had more money I would stay in something abit nicer.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, cheap hotel, basic accomodation.”
Reviews.Author: englishandpr0ud
Reviews.Content: me and my best friend were at college and decided we were going to go to london. we had like no budget. no not an unlimited budget.. just no money! we found a coach for Â£2.50 return each including insurance with national express. the hotel cost us Â£11 each per night and we stayed for 2 night, so for accomodation and travel.. Â£24.50! most hotels were more than triple this alone. perfect location,, about 2 minute walk from victoria station and we went to see Wicked (highly recommend! it was amazing) which was at victoria apollo.. about a 5 minute walk. buckingam palace is within walking distance and everywhere else is easy to get to courtesy of the underground being so close. i do not like walking but we walked from nottinghill to tower bridge and LOVED it. there really is so much to see try not to miss it all by taking the underground everywhere. theres a nandos round the corner too! :) you should probably be careful walking around there at night if you don't know it ( it was our first time to london), but its the same with any big city. there is also an old english pub at the end of the road which is really nice and serves bar food. right, accomodation. we opted for the shared bathroom to save money. the shower and toilet were separate and reasonably sized. fairly clean but not particularly nice lukily the hotel was pretty empty, so we had the shower and toilet to ourselves for the stay (atleast we didnt see anybody else use them) although they are in the communal area (on the stairs). the entire hotel smelt musty and we didnt get used to it. it wasnt as bad inside our room as outside the door. every step had different carpet which was bizarre and it was very dated. hotel staff were ok, not friendly but not rude. we didnt even attempt the breakfast as we didnt trust it given the state of the rest of the hotel. the room had patches of wall that had been repainted with several different colours which was.. amusing. the room was TINY and had 2 single beds in. we had to stand the suitcases up as there wasnt any room to lie them down and we had to climb across the beds to get around the room. there was a sink in our room and a tv (which didnt work) and a mini fridge. the accomodation was pretty awful to be honest, but that said we needed a cheap place to stay in london and it did the job. we left at 8 o' clock in the morning and didnt return till late at night when we collapsed ready to start the next day so it really was just a base. when we checked out we left our bags in the breakfast room where the hotel kept them for the day while we were gone. we did not have locks on our bags or suitcases and nothing was stolen but we didnt have anything in them. didnt look like they had been opened and they were in same place we left them. however, when we were checking out there was a man at reception complaining that hed had something stolen out of his room. only thing i had taken was a half packet of starburst by the maid, but perhaps something to watch out for. if your leaving bags in this room id recommend locking them,, we were lucky! if you can afford better accomodation then don't stay here. it was barely tolerable but very very cheap for its location and was the only way we could afford to stay in london. i wouldn't recommend it to anybody, but if i had a free weekend and a spare Â£30 i can think of worse things to spend it on :)

Reviews.Title: “If you want a terrible sleep and bed bugs, holly house is for you.”
Reviews.Author: sauerstiens
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for 2 nights in a twin room en suite. They put us into the annex building a few doors down from the main hotel.the positive: it's very close to victoria station, and walking distance to Buckingham palace (20 minutes). breakfast was included, and the staff serving breakfast was quite nice and helpful. there was a mini fridge in the room and a small TV. Now onto the negative: We arrived around 5:30pm in the rain and there was no one at reception to let us in the building, we rang the bell for 10-15 minutes before they finally answered. While we were being checked in, a man who looked like a homeless person came into the small reception area and was eyeing us. that should have been our cue to leave, but I thought it would be okay. the room was TINY. we could barely move around in it. you had to climb over the bed to get to the bathroom, and the bathroom was a cupboard. It was like a toilet on a train. tiny. tiny. tiny. they gave us bath towels, but no hand towels. and everything in the bathroom gets wet when you shower because it's that small. the first night I slept fine, but the second night I didn't sleep very well at all, and didn't figure out until morning that it was because there were BED BUGS eating me up. I woke up with bites on my feet & legs and waist, but the worst was my arms, shoulders and back. I still have discoloration from the bites. I would not ever ever ever recommend this hotel to anyone. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!!!”
Reviews.Author: GECJJC
Reviews.Content: Ok so cheap budget room in London! Not expecting much here! But oh dear!!! The "double" bed was maybe 3 inches bigger than a standard single. It was the most uncomfortable bed I have ever slept in! I would have slept on the floor, but there was not enough room to do so! I was also a bit wary of all the bugs crawling around the floor and shower. The bed was itchy and lumpy. The TV had very poor signal. The en-suite toilet! Well when you took a shower you were also washing the toilet pan! I am a 16st 6ft tall man and i was hitting my arms on the walls and head on ceiling. Was like taking a shower in a room the size of a toilet on a bus! The noise and heat in the room was fair enough! Its London after all! After a 12 hour bus journey all I wanted was a good nights sleep, but i would be lying if I said i had more than 1 hours sleep in broken 5 minute intervals! As for the comment on page 1 of the hotels website.... "Our warm, friendly hospitality is second to none, matching the stylish facilities and quality service to the perfect location." OMG!!! The staff did not smile, were not very friendly and really not overly helpful! I never saw any "stylish faclities" or "quality service"! The location is perfect for the tube, bus st and palace! There is always a gopod point. We were booked in for 2 nights (and charged for the 2 nights on arrival) After the first night we could not bear facing breakfast in that place! 1st thing we did that morning was to go round the corner to a bigger hotel. They gave us a big comfy room, with clean bathroom and facilities and free wi-fi. We paid a little more for this one, but worth every penny! They even let us check in at 9am so we could get out of the Holly House Hotel. The receptionist was NOT surprised to hear how unhappy we were with the Holly hotel (guess it must be a common occurence). I felt dirty after staying in this hotel. I will never be back. I have stayed in some bad places in my travels, but this was by far the worst I have ever been in. I guess they must have some nice rooms as a few people have made positive comments about the place! I would guarantee that if they were in our room from that night, they would have thought twice about a good review!

Reviews.Title: “Very very basic”
Reviews.Author: jeanblew
Reviews.Content: We were put in the Annexe part of the hotel on the top floor in a TINY standard room (only one person could walk round the bed at the same time). It was at the back of the hotel so the train noise from Victoria was VERY loud as you were overlooking the lines. It had a washbasin, TV, small fridge (which noisily came on and off all night) and tea/coffee making facilities. All generally clean although the carpet needed a good hoovering. Towels and sheets were clean and fresh. Shared shower and toilet area combined, outside on landing. It was the smallest area you could imagine (less than 5 feet by 2 feet) so when you had a shower all round the toilet flooded too! Breakfast was cornflakes or cocoa pops, orange juice, toast with various jams and tea or coffee. Having said all of that it was a reasonable price for such a central location, some people wouldn't like it but as we were going to be out sightseeing all day, all we wanted was a room with a bed for the night, which is just about what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for such price”
Reviews.Author: Lidashka
Reviews.Content: Please, compare prices of London Hotels. More of them is very expensive. It's very small and cheap hotel. I think, it's excellent for budget trip. Do not expect for 3 or 4 stars!!! We (family of 3 people) stayed there in early March in Triple Ensuite Room. Bathroom is inside the room. It very-very small, but enough. Room is very-very small, but enough :) It's smallest room I have ever seen. But we were in London first time, we had only 4 days and we only slept in the room and use bathroom in mornings and evenings. They made our room every day, our linen and towels was always clean. Breakfasts include in price. It's corn-flakes with milk, toast with butter and jam, orange juice and tea or coffee. In room you can find towels, cattle, glasses, cups, spoons, tea, coffee and sugar, small fridge. You can have hair drier for deposit 5 pounds. Location is great! Bus station is very close(we use bus for airport transfer and for trip in Windsor) and underground is just in few blocks. I didn't like stuff on check-in desk and on breakfasts. We have no problems with them, but I think they can smile even sometimes...

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bachandbacon
Reviews.Content: I called the Holly House and made my own reservation. The Holly House Hotel is a very basic hotel. If you are expecting a large, elegant rooms with service 24 hours a day, this is the wrong hotel for you. If you want a basic room, in a very convenient location, this might just be the place for you. My room was on the 3rd floor and had a small refrigerator. The toilet was about 6 steps up from my room and the shower on the floor below. This hotel does have en-suite rooms but I could only afford the basic. I was greeted nicely by the owner/manager and was always treated kindly. The breakfast was again basic but enough. The rooms were quiet and a wonderful breeze kept my room cool even during the several rather warm days. Each room has a colour TV and tea and coffee facilities. The hotel backs up to train tracks right at Victoria Station and I was afraid that the noise would bother me but I was never disturbed by any noise at all. I stayed at the Holly House over 3 weeks so I was there long enough to get to know the area. I will stay there again in the future as I visit London every year.

Reviews.Title: “No No No”
Reviews.Author: Lori876
Reviews.Content: Unclean and the staff was definitely intimidating. I was traveling as a single woman and please do not go there if you are single woman traveling alone. I would go out every evening for dinner and the staff would be out smoking with friends or other staff members and they would be obviously saying lude things about me walking away from the hotel. I would actually sleep with the lights and tv on to make them think I was up in the middle of the night (even though the tv didn't go very loud) and this place gave me the heabie jeebies. It was unclean and I couldn't wait to get out of there. So much so that my flight didn't leave until the late afternoon the day I left and I checked out on that day at 9 am and because of luggage...went straight to the airport. No way was I storing my luggage while I went sightseeing for a few hours. Lock your luggage in the room. I just had a bad feeling like I was being watched!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay okay”
Reviews.Author: andyrossjohnston
Reviews.Content: Same same is a simple bed and breakfast in london super location and close to tube station - the room was small but okay and clean i found the staff friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Hotel behind subway station!!!”
Reviews.Author: livingstein
Reviews.Content: Roos are extremely small and most of them overlooking the train station. I asked for a quiet room and the receptionist who works in the evenings ( a very unfriendly guy) gave me a room in the Alexander Hotel (which is the same crap hotel belonging to the Holly House) with a view to the platform of the London underground!!. The room in question has the weird name of AA. I told him to give me another room, and although he pretended to find something better for me, it was obvious that he didn't care. So he ended up saying that either I should take it or leave it; Actually that was what I did next day (before being sure that I got back the rest of the cash I paid in advance the day before). Be careful because they ask for the whole amount in advance. So if you decide to reserve a room here, don't pay till you have seen the room. The toilets are so small that you wonder how you can get in (no joking) I have to admit that the receptionist in the morning-afternoon are friendly and helpful but the guy in the evenings tends to act against guest's desires

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and horrible!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: spptopal
Reviews.Content: I had the "pleasure" of staying in this hotel for 5 nights! Yes, i did manage to survive! I booked the hotel from website and was never warned what i was about to experience! OK, it is really cheap and dead central but, dear God i would not never repeat that experience! The rooms are tiny (i booked a double room and 2 people cannot have their suitcases open at the same time!!!!), the curtain and carpet had not been washed for maybe a decade, the bed linen were not changed thoughtout my stay, we did however have clean towels every day. The WC and shower rooms are equally claustrophobic and dirty especially the shower room! Oh, did i mention the broken window in my room and the leaking ceiling (when the people in the upstairs room were taking a shower, it was leaking in my room !!!!) I will not of course mention the two arguments that i had with the reception clerk who was quite rude and sarcastic! Do yourselves a favour, if you plan on staying in London for more than 1 night, don't stay there, you deserve better than that !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Linfield-FC
Reviews.Content: Don't know what people are complaining about! This a low-priced hotel located within walking distance of most of London's tourist traps along with Victoria Coach Station and Victoria Rail Station. It is not the Dorchestor, Hilton, or the Ritz, and anyone should know this by the cost, for the same price as an over-night stay one wouldn't get a meal at the Ritz. The rooms at HHH could be a little fresher, but lets' face it we're talking basically about a bed for the night, not a suite of rooms etc. The hotel was quiet at night which is extremely important. Ok trains running into Victoria can be a pain. At less than Â£40 for a room, the HHH is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mio_riccio
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that I am an experienced budget traveler that has lived in Europe. So I am not expecting The Ritz when I check into a 70 pound room. What I do expect is the room to be clean. There was standing dirt on the carpet through out the entire room. To mask to dirt smell the management placed large purple air fresheners throughout the room. The combination was overpowering. The room was a triple with a double bed and a set of bunk beds. There was approximately 2 feet between the top and bottom bunks making it difficult for an adult to use the lower one. There was only an18 inch path between the two beds, and the bathroom door could only open half way because of the overcrowding of the room. For one person to get dressed the other two had to literally sit on their beds to allow room. I have stayed in some very basic accommodations but this was by far the worst hotel I have ever experienced. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone that does not just want a dirty basic place to crash for a night.

Reviews.Title: “absolute nightmare”
Reviews.Author: pixie2309
Reviews.Content: I was in London for a short stay and a self prescribed low budget trip.Booking a room near Victoria seemed like a sensible thing to do since it was close to my area of interest.I must admit that I wasn't expecting too much but even so I was amazed that such a place could exist in central london.The room was filthy and smelly and it hasn't been cleaned in years.For an additional 3 pounds I was promised an en suite batroom wich was nothing else than a airing cupboard tranformed into a loo with an incorporated rusty shower squeezed into the corner.The trains from Victoria rushed right past my head by the minute but the worst part was listening to the continuing announcements -opening the window seemed sheer madness at the time.By 7am I was wide awake and left the hotel without any breakfast because I was too annoyed to eat and not convinced by their hygenic standards.Overall impression?If you want to listen to moving trains, book a bench at Victoria Station.It's cheaper!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, terrible, the managers rude...”
Reviews.Author: RosytaK
Reviews.Content: It was horrible, it was the only thing that made my travel to London to be a little bad... we had made the reservations via internet. We went from spain, and we had the copy of the reservation. But, when we arrived there, the "manager", that... "nice" man, so pleasant, and so.... I don't know how to describe him... rude? told us that we had not made a reservation for a room with bathroom. then we told him we wanted bathrooms, and he wanted to put us all (six people) in a room which was no more than 8 square metres. Finally, we found three double rooms with bathroom (it was exactly a cupboard which had become a bathroom). My bedroom was inclined, so the floor was not 90 degrees to the wall, but more or less 110, so my feet slept higher than my head... It was a complete disaster... The boy who took us to our bedrooms only pointed to the fact that the rooms had TELEVISION.... yes, there was a teapot...but.. who could drink there?!!! And finally, the best of all... we could not pay by card. He wanted us to pay a part in cash and another part by card. This made us suspicious that he was getting undeclared income. so we told him he was a thief, and we were calling the police... he told us that he was the one who was going to call the police and we would go to jail hahaha... The best of all was when he threw us out...Yes, he threw us out of his hotel, shouting and insulting... And then he apologized and he told us he expected to see us there again..... hahahaha Isn't he mad? If a manager treats people in such a rude way, what can he expect but not to see his customers again? In short: the worst experience in my travels.

Reviews.Title: “Reservations are useless”
Reviews.Author: Guillo2014
Reviews.Content: I found a room in London for less than 30 pounds. I reserved well in advance before my travel. I knew I couldn't expect much, all I need was a place to sleep a nigth, before continuing my trip. Well... I arrived from the Americas afther a long trip and badly sleep. I had some troubles finding it, but it was ok. When I finally found the place, they told there was a problem with my reservation, something about my credit card they said. And unfortunatly they didn't had any room for me. They told not to worry and chose any of the nearby hotels, tell them I was their customer and they will give me a room, I asked at to places... they say they were full. I returned a got very angry, they took me to another hotel which had I think and emergency room. It wasn't so nice and they charged me about 5 pounds more then what I had reserved at the first hotel. It was an awful experience, they made me loose valuable time for touring the city, they spoiled my short visit at London. I understand you can expect much for a room under 30 pounds, but at least you expect it will be avaiable when you arrive. I strongly recomend not to reserve this hotel, maybe if you arrive without reservation and are lucky enough they'll have a cheap room. But you can't trust on your reservation.

Reviews.Title: “It is a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is a budget hotel. You are not paying more so you could not expect more. Over all my experience is not bad you can afford the prices. Very reasonable stay in Victoria. Location is very good except noise from the train running back of the hotel. But who expect more service and more laxurious there is Blair Victoria hotel a five star hotel five minutes from Holly house hotel.

Reviews.Title: “planning to book here..? don't!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Bookings donÂ´t mean anything to the "managers" of this hotel. We had booked well in advance, had given bank details in order to "guarantee" the rooms and had received two confirmations of the bookings. There were no mistakes or misunderstandings on our part. On arrival we were informed that the rooms were not available.....period. Absolutely unethical behaviour...to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible But Cheap”
Reviews.Author: miguelAsturias_spain
Reviews.Content: We made the reservation via internet and when we got there,there was no room,although we called the previous evening. they offered a tiny single room for two people giving no explanation. We spent the first night in another b&b(horrible too). The second day at eleven they offered a temporal twin room in one of the b&b they manage, and the third day at the same time we moved to the final room. we missed a lot of time there. This is the cheapest b&b in london but awful staff and bad organization, some smelly rooms. they rule alexander,anexe,ivy,holly house,cedar b&b, all terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap”
Reviews.Author: Mama2Jack
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we only needed a one night stay before an early morning flight out of Gatwick. This room was very inexpensive, and the hotel was located very close to Victoria Station and the Gatwick Express. When we arrived, we were actually placed in the Cedar Guest house down the street. We had a double with shared bath. Our room faced the street and was very quiet. The bathroom faced the rear of the building and had a lot of train noice. The room was extremely small; by far the smallest room we had in all of our european travels. The room was not the cleanest, and I would not have wanted to stay there for more than one night.

HotelInfo.Name: Holly House Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 20 Hugh Street, London SW1V 1RP, England
